instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR: What is PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR? This is the input that comes from the charger..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PM_EN_P3V3_G3H: What is PM_EN_P3V3_G3H? PM_EN_P3V3_G3H is a signal that enables the PP3V3_G3H rail to turn on. This comes out of ISL9239 or ISL9240 chip; when missing, often is missing because of a bad ISL9239 or ISL9240 chip. .
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message: Stuck on 5v no loop. Doide mode on CB151 those 3 capacitors is 0.012. I get 5.2v on <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message: Check voltage and diode mode readings on LDO rails of all <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.

threads.message:
UB300  - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO</SIGNAL> 3.3v
UB400  - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TB_LDO</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<CHIP>U3200</CHIP>  -  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<CHIP>U3100</CHIP>  -  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL> 3.3v

All diode mode reading 470

threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C7651</CAPACITOR> was missing someone before ripped it from the board i replaced it and rewired  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> line to <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message: Not sure if this line should have very low diode mode reading 0.012...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message:
Not sure, compare with L2950.

LDO readings look normal.
Do you get voltage at <SIGNAL>1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> lines?
Be aware, is only available on the powered port.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message: I measured one by one I don't get  <SIGNAL>1V1_LDO</SIGNAL>  on any of them voltage. I compared with another board and the diode mode reading on CB151/2/3 are not suppose to be like that

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message: Also i removed the 3 caps and still same Low and goes to UB000

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message:
Lift the coil and check where the low value remains.
BTW, what is the value on L2950?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message: Diode Value on  L2950  both sides is 210 and on LB150 contact 2 diode is 0.016 which goes directly to some capacitors and UB000...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message:
So you have a problem on LB150 area.
Both coils are placed on similar power rails.
UB000 is the first suspect...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message: I took out UB000 low resistance gone and i replaced it from another board same exact. The diode mode reading are now same from both sides but stuck on 5v still no power...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message:
Possible that UB000 is not soldered good or some other issue... any ideas? 

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message: Be aware, 1V1 LDO must appear only on the powered port.

threads.message: Yes I tried them all one by one :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message:
Then you still have problems on USB-C areas.

<CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips good for sure?
Possibly bad solders, broken traces...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message: Nothing that seems as a possible problem when checked under microscope all of them seem fine nothing broken in that area. <CAPACITOR>C7651</CAPACITOR> was broken off complete but i returned it in place

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message: D6902on pin 2 i have 5v and i don't have <SIGNAL>PM_EN_P3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> Enable signal which comes from <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message: I replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> i got the EN signal still stuck on 5v <SIGNAL>O_O</SIGNAL>:ROFLMAO:

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09
threads.message:
The <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> that i replaced was used and not good probably i found old stock new <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> replaced it after i git the EN signal on <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> but the final solution was <DIODE>D6902</DIODE> and got 20v powers on now.

Disclaimer:  No <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> were harmed during the repair  :cool: ??

Thanks for the help
